Title: IT Director of Enterprise Analytics
Job_Description:
Job Details:
Reporting directly to the VP of IT Insights-as-a-Service this role will help implement the Analytics strategy with responsibility for all aspects of end user analytics experience at Tyson Foods. This role will be ultimately responsible for enabling Tyson employee partners and customers better access to data and tools that drive insights and effective decision making. With analytics first goal this role will help develop the analytics strategy and business framework to enable this for custom built and off the shelf solutions. Team leadership and evolving Tyson Foods skill profile will be required as we continue to pursue our strategy towards a cloud native modern data platform. This strategy should be broader than just reports and dashboards and should align with Tyson’s analytics first strategy to enable our business with data driven decision making. A rich history of building strong end user experiences in analytics products with a strong focus on driving business outcomes through data is required. This role must have a strong technical background in data and data systems to ensure robust, flexible and scalable solutions. Additionally, this role will require building strong business relationships, adapting to new and changing business climates and a strong business acumen.
Yes


1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Title: IT Director of Enterprise Analytics
Job_Description:
Job Details:
The Automation organization is a growing organization at Tyson Foods that is responsible for the development and validation of innovative robotics and automation technologies and solutions that improve team member safety, optimize labor and yield, ensure food safety, and provide a framework for sustainable profitability.
As a Lead Automation and Robotics engineer, you will study Tyson operations and work with analysts and process experts to come up with innovative robotics and automation solutions that can be standardized and scaled within Tyson. This can involve sourcing solutions from established vendors, co-developing solutions with our strategic vendors, collaborating with startup companies, and/or doing R&D work to create solutions that are unique to Tyson needs. This role will technically lead a team to identify opportunities, develop proof of concept solutions and present to executive leadership. These opportunities will be founded in data from our systems of record and this team will be solving problems that best meet the needs of our business and are in high demand. Upon approval, this position would then lead the implementation of these solutions into production facilities. It will require a strong partnership with the existing engineering groups, production plant leadership, maintenance teams, IT organization and executive leadership. In this role you will work closely with others and lead / mentor more junior team members to deliver against objectives.
Yes


1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Title: IT Director of Enterprise Analytics
Job_Description:
Job Details:
Job Purpose/Summary:
This role will be part of a new team that is being commissioned to investigate, evaluate and develop automation solutions for Tyson Foods. The role will consist of visiting, documenting and solutioning new automation and robotics capabilities into Tyson’s production plants. This is a role focused on the use of modern technologies such as Internet of Things, predictive and prescriptive analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence. This role / team will identify opportunities, develop proof of concept solutions and present to executive leadership. Upon approval, this team would then work to implement these solutions into production facilities. It will require a strong partnership with the Information Technology team, existing engineering groups, production plant leadership and executive leadership.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Visit plant locations, learn and understand the production processes; identify and document automation opportunities
Yes


1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Title: IT Director of Enterprise Analytics
Job_Description:
Job Details:
This role will join a team that is responsible for plant readiness and the plant adoption of standard automated and robotic systems at Tyson Foods. The role will consist of visiting plant locations, documenting opportunities related to automation and improving the use of Tyson standard automated solutions through training and development of plant personnel. The automation team is responsible for identifying opportunities, developing proof of concept solutions and programmatically rolling out approved solutions. This position will provide ongoing support and training for installed standard automation solutions, focused on systematic and sustainable improvement and ongoing feedback into RND teams for enhancements to technology.
It will require a strong partnerships with the Information Technology team, Continuous improvement team, Reliable Maintenance and training teams, existing engineering groups, production plant leadership and executive leadership.

Tyson Foods, Inc. is one of the world’s largest food companies and a recognized leader in protein. We are a company who innovates continually to make protein more sustainable, tailor food for everywhere it’s available and raise the world’s expectations for how much good food can do.
Globally, we are headquartered in the United States, with nearly 130,000 team members worldwide. Through its Core Values, Tyson Foods strives to operate with integrity, create value for its shareholders, customers, communities, and team members and serve as a steward of the animals, land and environment entrusted to it.
What is Tyson Technology?
The Technology Team at Tyson Foods is building the technology of the future. We’re transforming an 85-year-old company into the most modern food company in the world. We’re developing technologies that are used in our offices, in our plants, and in our farms. We’re building technologies that are changing the way this company works. We are utilizing cutting-edge technologies from machine learning to artificial intelligence to drones, that will help drive our business forward. At Tyson Foods we’re driving world class technology to revolutionize a world class company.

Job Details:
Fresh Meats Business is looking to transform and over the next couple of years will be transitioning to SAP. The SAP Program Manager will assist in a multi-year SAP S4 implementation and some other additional Strategic initiatives. This person must have experience going through an SAP implementations and 100% of their time will be dedicated to this project. 1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Title: Data Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Details:
The Data Analyst position requires knowledge of the biological, physical, and engineering sciences that make possible safe and wholesome food products; of food industry facilities, methods, processes, equipment capabilities and limitations; and of relevant laws, regulations, and governmental oversight. This position is responsible for providing strategic business initiatives; assisting with the development, implementation, and support of internally developed business applications and processes; and technical and functional support of data-based applications and business systems for the internal/external users of the portfolio of the Product Development Management (PDM) systems used across the Enterprise. Data Analyst will be responsible for effectively and accurately assisting Business Unit management, FSQA, Technical Services, Continuous Improvement, and R&D technologists in creating required components for effective product specification execution within the Global Specification Management (GSM) system across approximately 118 production locations and multiple co-manufacturers. The Data Analyst performs duties with considerable latitude for the exercise of independent judgment that requires considerable professional, scientific, or technical training or experience which has demonstrated capacity for sound independent work. Incorrect decisions or actions could result in halting production or even removal of product from commerce, which would result in financial costs to the Company. Additionally, the Data Analyst needs to have knowledge of, and skill in, applying network principles and concepts; systems administration methods and procedures; customer support principles; IT security principles; troubleshooting methods; and utilize communication methods and techniques in providing guidance to our internal/external customers.


Yes


1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Title: Data Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Details:
SUMMARY: This position is responsible for leading technical analysis and development of the integration, testing, operations, and maintenance of security systems and infrastructure. Configures security infrastructure and tools (e.g. firewalls, IDS/IPS, vulnerability management). Ensures that security infrastructure and tools are properly maintained, updated, and are working to specification. Provides technical support to customers who need assistance. Performs network security analysis to understand vulnerabilities and can create, coordinate, and execute plans for mitigation. Implements network security controls and assists with the evaluation of organization security policies and procedures.
REQUIREMENTS:
Education & Experience: College degree (or equivalent experience) with 8+ years of progressive experience in business or IT environment or advanced degree with 6+ years of progressive experience.
Must have the ability to communicate technical information to non-technical team members. Practical knowledge of network security and vulnerability management scanning and remediation techniques; ability to analyze and interpret information technology proposals and evaluate and develop alternative implementation plans.

Title: Data Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Details:
The Senior Data Analyst position requires knowledge of the biological, physical, and engineering sciences that make possible safe and wholesome food products; of food industry facilities, methods, processes, equipment capabilities and limitations; and of relevant laws, regulations, and governmental oversight. This position is responsible for involvement with the planning, development, implementation, and administration of systems for the acquisition, storage, and retrieval of data within the data-based applications and business systems for the internal/external users of the portfolio of the Product Development Management (PDM) systems used across the Enterprise. Additionally, the Data Manager needs to have knowledge of, and skill in, applying network principles and concepts; systems administration methods and procedures; customer support principles; IT security principles; troubleshooting methods; and utilize communication methods and techniques in providing guidance to our internal/external customers.

Summary:
As part of the Cybersecurity team, the Sr Analyst – Security Governance, Risk, and Compliance provides guidance and support for security governance, risk management, and compliance requirements in support of Tyson’s Security and IT program. 1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Title: Business Intelligence and Analytics Partner- Human Resources
Job_Description:
Job Details:
Tyson Foods is a progressive, global food company raising the world’s expectations for how much good food can do. Tyson is on a multi-year journey to transform into a more digital, data-driven organization. HR is at the forefront of this transformation – including new investments in HR Business Intelligence (BI) and Analytics capabilities. Come see what makes Tyson Foods a great place to work – and get in on the ground floor.
Summary:
The HR BI and Analytics Partner is a full-cycle, consultative BI and Analytics professional – with the ability to scope enterprise BI and ad-hoc analytical projects; execute the project; and present back observations and insights to stakeholders (from the Executive and Board level to front-line HR and business leaders). They will support the delivery of the HR strategy by querying workforce and survey data; manipulating/ combining/ ”munging” it; and developing observations and insights from analysis rooted in data. Then, they will package consumable observations and insights to support HR and business leaders in making data-driven decisions. The HR BI and Analytics Partner should be curious; able scope/shape stakeholder problem statements; capable of digging into the data for non-obvious or counter-intuitive insights; and be both detailed-oriented and able to see the big picture.
Yes

Job Details:
Summary:
As part of the Prepared Foods Engineering Discipline team, the Engineer III will utilize their experience and knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology focusing on projects which support the scope and budgeting generation, design, construction, and project management of large-scale capital projects within the Prepared Foods manufacturing network and the Warehousing & Transportation network for Tyson Corporate. This position focuses on applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services focusing on Electrical.

Amwell is a leading telehealth platform in the United States and globally, connecting and enabling providers, insurers, patients, and innovators to deliver greater access to more affordable, higher quality care. Tyson Foods, Inc. is one of the world’s largest food companies and a recognized leader in protein. We are a company who innovates continually to make protein more sustainable, tailor food for everywhere it’s available and raise the world’s expectations for how much good food can do.
Globally, we are headquartered in the United States, with nearly 130,000 team members worldwide. Through its Core Values, Tyson Foods strives to operate with integrity, create value for its shareholders, customers, communities, and team members and serve as a steward of the animals, land and environment entrusted to it.
What is Tyson Technology?
The IT Team at Tyson Foods is building the technology of the future. We’re transforming an 85-year-old company into the most modern food company in the world. We’re developing technologies that are used in our offices, they’re used in our plants, in our farms, they’re used everywhere. We’re building technologies that are changing the way this company works. Everything from machine learning to artificial intelligence to utilizing cutting edge tech like drones, that will help drive our business forward. At Tyson Foods we’re driving world class technology to revolutionize a world class company.



No


1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Title: Data Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Details:
The Data Analyst position requires knowledge of the biological, physical, and engineering sciences that make possible safe and wholesome food products; of food industry facilities, methods, processes, equipment capabilities and limitations; and of relevant laws, regulations, and governmental oversight. This position is responsible for providing strategic business initiatives; assisting with the development, implementation, and support of internally developed business applications and processes; and technical and functional support of data-based applications and business systems for the internal/external users of the portfolio of the Product Development Management (PDM) systems used across the Enterprise. Data Analyst will be responsible for effectively and accurately assisting Business Unit management, FSQA, Technical Services, Continuous Improvement, and R&D technologists in creating required components for effective product specification execution within the Global Specification Management (GSM) system across approximately 118 production locations and multiple co-manufacturers. The Data Analyst performs duties with considerable latitude for the exercise of independent judgment that requires considerable professional, scientific, or technical training or experience which has demonstrated capacity for sound independent work. Incorrect decisions or actions could result in halting production or even removal of product from commerce, which would result in financial costs to the Company. Additionally, the Data Analyst needs to have knowledge of, and skill in, applying network principles and concepts; systems administration methods and procedures; customer support principles; IT security principles; troubleshooting methods; and utilize communication methods and techniques in providing guidance to our internal/external customers.


Yes

1ST SHIFT (United States of America)

Title: Data Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Details:
SUMMARY:
This Corporate Payroll position is responsible for processing all domestic payroll, safeguarding confidential data and providing a high level of customer service to all Team Members within the company. Responsibilities include: to ensure the accurate calculation of wages, tax withholding and company deductions; statistical reporting on Team Member’s regular and miscellaneous pay, deductions, tax withholdings, etc.; overseeing the distribution of paychecks, direct deposit advices and to help administer the electronic pay programs; ensures payroll records are updated and reports on any matters of interest; managing BI Reconciliation report; resolve Payroll issues with TEAM members, HR, management, and plant location personnel; facilitating team calls/meetings; assist with team reviews; managing team metrics including KPIs; maintain a neutral budget; and other miscellaneous duties. This position will also provide back-up for various payroll processes including but not limited to garnishment, times system, relocation, and other miscellaneous cross training duties.
